title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Tuesday, July 25 (game #547)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: New Sony Xperia 5 V leaks suggests the phone will bizarrely lose its telephoto lens
description: The leaks also reveal the Xperia 5 V will have a similar screen to the Xperia 1 IV and see the return of Zeiss T* lens coating.

title: Bing AI is rolling out to Chrome and Safari, but the experience may not be as good
description: As Bing Chat opens up, Microsoft will be scaling back some basic features like forcing short conversations with the AI.

title: Possible upcoming AMD Ryzen 9 7950X3D CPU could give Intel a run for its money
description: New leaks on the AMD Ryzen 9 7950X3D CPU's specs show off how powerful it could be and how much of a threat it poses to Intel.

title: Brace yourselves, the iPhone 15 Pro series could get a price hike
description: Apple’s next-gen iPhone is rumored to come with a next-gen price hike.

title: Samsung's Galaxy S24 could come with an unwanted downgrade in Europe
description: Samsung's Galaxy S24 is now rumored to be coming with an Exynos chip in Europe in what could mark a regression from the excellent S23 series

title: These are the world's most censored countries
description: Researchers analyzed the use of VPNs, and the status of porn sites (among other things) to find the strictest nations.

title: Spotify officially hikes its Premium prices in the US – here's how it compares
description: Spotify follows Apple Music, Amazon Music and Tidal in increasing the prices it charges users.

title: Sony's WF-1000XM5 earbuds launch: smaller earpieces, extra mics and more
description: Sony's best-ever true wireless earbuds promise big improvements in pretty much every area.

title: AMD’s Radeon RX 7800 and 7700 could be launching any day now - here’s why I’m excited
description: AMD’s midrange RDNA 3 graphics cards might see a full reveal at Gamescom 2023 in Germany.

title: Data stolen in MOVEit breach leaked by notorious ransomware gang
description: Russian ransomware group Clop is estimated to make up to $100 million from its MOVEit campaign.

title: Linux is consorting with tech behemoths to improve ethernet standards
description: Cisco, Microsoft, AMD, Intel and Meta among those pushing for Ethernet standards for HPC and AI.

title: Google Chrome's cookie-replacing tools are set for launch
description: Google Chrome on the cusp of opening up API testing as it looks to phase out third-party cookies by the end of 2024.

title: Companies are feeling pressured to use ChatGPT and other AI tools
description: Businesses are looking to invest in generative AI for CX workers, to help increase productivity and reduce burnout.

title: More bigger and cheaper OLED TVs are on the cards thanks to LG’s deal with Samsung
description: Big OLED TVs could be about to get a whole lot cheaper thanks to the expansion of a historic deal between Samsung and LG.

title: Invincible Presents: Atom Eve offers a comic-book style visual novel on PC
description: Invincible Presents: Atom Eve takes the spotlight as the first video game adaptation of the Invincible universe this year.

title: Amazon is forcing workers to relocate as it tries to enfore a return to the office
description: Remote Amazon employees are being told to come into the office, while other office-based workers may have to relocate.`

title: We won’t be seeing an M3 Mac Mini or MacBook Pro for a while - but the M3 chips might still make a debut this year
description: Apple's M3 chips are long-awaited, and while we may not see new Mac Mini or MacBook Pro, we'll still be fed!

title: Vodafone reveals strong results, appoints new CFO ahead of Three merger
description: New Vodafone CFO Luka Mucic is taking the rains on September 1.

title: Microsoft denies Chinese hackers could have cracked its cloud services too
description: Microsoft plays down reports from Wiz researchers claiming recent breach was much bigger than previously thought.

title: Super Mario Bros. Wonder release date, gameplay, and everything we know
description: The Super Mario Bros. Wonder release date is just around the corner. Here's what we know about the game so far.

title: Windows 11 will now warn you when you copy and paste your system password
description: Users of the latest Windows 11 Preview Build will now see an alert when they copy and paste their credentials.

title: Live: Twitter's strange X rebrand explained and ChatGPT comes to Android
description: Your quick fix of today's tech news – including Twitter's new rebranding to X, and the imminent arrival of ChatGPT's Android app.

title: Data breach costs hit new high, so make sure your business is patched
description: Affected businesses keep making the same mistakes, report claims.

title: Mortal Kombat 1's SDCC trailer brings back Baraka, Li Mei, and Tanya
description: Mortal Kombat 1's SDCC panel reveals plenty to be excited about

title: It's official, J.K. Simmons is returning as Omni-Man in Mortal Kombat 1
description: Co-creator of Mortal Kombat 1, Ed Boon, has announced that J.K. Simmons will be returning as Omni-Man in the DLC.

title: Armored Core 6's multiplayer has six-player arena battles
description: Japanese physical copies of Armored Core 6 show the game potentially supports up to six-player PvP battles.

title: Diablo 4 team concedes that latest patch "is not fun"
description: Diablo 4's development team used the latest Campfire Chat to apologize for their alleged mistakes with the latest patch.
